title: 'This conflicted place made me who I am': Santiago, Chile – a cartoon
text:
The Illustrated City: Cartoonist Panchulei was born by the Plaza Baquedano – a place that is a symbol of stark social division and the setting for the best moments in Chilean history

'This conflicted place made me who I am': Santiago, Chile – a cartoon

Panchulei is the nom de plume of Chilean cartoonist and publisher Francisca Cárcamo Rojas. More of her work can be found at her website, panchulei.com, or on Instagram, where she is @panchulei

Translation by James Scorer, senior lecturer in Latin American cultural studies at the University of Manchester and project lead for Comics and the Latin American City, funded by The Leverhulme Trust

If you’re an illustrator or graphic artist with an idea for The Illustrated City series, email us at Cities@theguardian.com

Follow Guardian Cities on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram to join the discussion, catch up on our best stories or sign up for our weekly newsletter
description: The Illustrated City: Cartoonist Panchulei was born by the Plaza Baquedano – a place that is both a symbol of stark social division and the setting for the best moments in Chilean history
